column4: Hi! After installing Hardy, I find that my audacity does not recognize output devices.  I tried reinstalling audacity.  No use.  Is there a way to let audacity detect my audio device?
What do you mean? Under "preferences" what audio driver are you using?
Under preferences, there is none listed. I am not able to enter anything there.
Under "preferences" in Audacity--under "audio I/O" what devices can you select?

As you said, I was able to select between ALSA and another restricted ATI driver before upgrading to Hardy. Now the device field under -preferences/audio IO - nothing is listed. It is blank and I am not able to select anything.  However, under input (Microphone) I have-OSS,ALSA still listed.
OK, if you go under System > Admin/Prefs > Sound, do you have ALSA selected for everything? That would be a good thing to check.
let me check.- It is OK under sound. ALSA is displayed in all the fields.
Is your problem only in Audacity? Can you play sound from other programs?
Yes. My other apps like Amarok,Rhythmbox, mplayer etc., do work great.
Are you using version 1.3.x from the repositories? I had problems with that beta version crashing, so I went with the official stable release, 1.2.x. That might be your problem.
Have you tried running audacity from the terminal? You could then see if it returns any errors that might help you figure out what is wrong.
Before you do that, try running audacity in a terminal to see if it returns any errors (just type "audacity" in a terminal).
I also want to report this audio detection problem  with this beta version to help the developers? (Hoping it will be of a wee-bit help)
Yes, but first see what errors (if any) you get when you run the program, and try to select an audio driver.
Running in terminal gave a lot of errors. However audacity just popped up with the same error. May I PM the error to you? I cannot flood the errors here.( about 20 lines)
Please pastebin the errors (pastebin.com)

I have selected just two lines from the error lot for reference. quote: -Expression 'parameters->channelCount <= maxChans' failed in 'src/hostapi/alsa/pa_linux_alsa.c', line: 924 second line: Expression 'ValidateParameters( outputParameters, hostApi, StreamDirection_Out )' failed in 'src/hostapi/alsa/pa_linux_alsa.c', line: 1142
Can't you pastebin all the errors please?
The URL is -http://pastebin.com/d6d6fc336
Did you install Audacity through the repositories or did you compile it yourself?

I think your best bet is give the 1.2.x version a try. Be sure to first uninstall your 1.3 version, and uou can download the 1.2.6 version here: http://packages.ubuntu.com/feisty-updates/i386/audacity/download

I see, well I suggested going ahead and trying the 1.2.6 stable release, which you can get at: http://packages.ubuntu.com/feisty-updates/i386/audacity/download  (be sure to uninstall the 1.3 version first)
No problem, good luck with it. :)
